item.title: [PI] Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

I followed this guys tutorial on this.
http://www.r/u/n/e-s/e/r/v/e/r.org/runescape-development/r/s/2-server/tutorials/350159-pi-dungeoneering-base-7.html
I cannot seem to fix the errors that I am getting. I fixed the ClickingButtons.java error but now I have 8 errors saying it cannot find symbols…

src\server\model\players\Client.java:44: error: cannot find symbol private Dungeoneering dungeoneering = new Dungeoneering(this); ^ symbol: class Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:787: error: cannot find symbol public Dungeoneering getDungeoneering() { ^ symbol: class Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:44: error: cannot find symbol private Dungeoneering dungeoneering = new Dungeoneering(this); ^ symbol: class Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:160: error: cannot find symbol if (Dungeoneering.Dung(this)) { ^ symbol: variable Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:161: error: package Dungeoneering does not exist Dungeoneering.gameRoom.remove(this); ^ src\server\model\players\Client.java:309: error: cannot find symbol if (Dungeoneering.Dung(this)) { ^ symbol: variable Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:310: error: package Dungeoneering does not exist Dungeoneering.gameRoom.remove(this); ^ src\server\model\players\ActionHandler.java:25: error: cannot find symbol Dungeoneering.handleObject(c, objectType, obX, obY); ^ symbol: variable Dungeoneering location: class ActionHandler Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 8 errors Press any key to continue . . .
EDIT: I know it has something to do with this:
import server.model.players.skills.Dungeoneering;
but I have no idea where to put it…

Read full topic

If you took this from a snippet, i found a few errors. First, there’s no opening bracket on line 1319. And second, you put the “case” in the class incorrectly. Make sure its in a switch statement.

item.title: [PI] Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Okay I tried that and I get these errors.

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:434: error: 'else' without 'if' } else if (c.dialogueAction != 8) { ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:444: error: orphaned case case 29188: ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1319: error: illegal start of type if (c.isAutoButton(actionButtonId)) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1319: error: <identifier> expected if (c.isAutoButton(actionButtonId)) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1319: error: ';' expected if (c.isAutoButton(actionButtonId)) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1319: error: illegal start of type if (c.isAutoButton(actionButtonId)) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1319: error: <identifier> expected if (c.isAutoButton(actionButtonId)) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1319: error: ';' expected if (c.isAutoButton(actionButtonId)) ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1320: error: illegal start of type c.assignAutocast(actionButtonId); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1320: error: <identifier> expected c.assignAutocast(actionButtonId); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:1323: error: class, interf ace, or enum expected } ^ 11 errors Press any key to continue . . .
This is what the code looks like and I know I screwed something up.

case 9158: } else if (c.dialogueAction != 8) { c.dialogueAction = 0; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); } else { c.dialogueAction = 1327; c.getDungeoneering().leaveDung(c); break; }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

case 9158: if (c.dialogueAction == 8) { c.getPA().fixAllBarrows(); } else { c.dialogueAction = 0; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); } else { c.dialogueAction = 1327; c.getDungeoneering().leaveDung(c); break; }

this. You can’t have to “} else {” One has to be “} else if (expresion) {”
do like:

} else if (c.dialogueAction != 8) { c.dialogueAction = 0; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); } else { c.dialogueAction = 1327; c.getDungeoneering().leaveDung(c); break; }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Yep, here you go.

[code]package server.model.content.skills;

/**

  • @author Resolute
  • Dungeoneering
    */

import java.util.HashMap;
import server.Server;
import server.model.players.Client;

public class Dungeoneering {

public static HashMap<Client, Integer> gameRoom = new HashMap<Client, Integer>();     

private Client c;
public Dungeoneering(Client Client) {
	this.c = Client;
}

public int[] startItems = new int[] {1725,1127,1079,5698,4587,10828,7462,6568,3105,8850};

public void spawnDungNpc() {
	Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, 3622, 3239, 9326, 0, 0, 100, 30, 10, 30, false, false);
	Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, 3622, 3246, 9326, 0, 0, 100, 30, 10, 30, false, false);
	Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, 3622, 3243, 9327, 0, 0, 100, 30, 10, 30, false, true);
	
	Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, 3622, 3254, 9333, 0, 0, 100, 30, 10, 30, false, true);
	Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, 3622, 3256, 9334, 0, 0, 100, 30, 10, 30, false, true);
	Server.npcHandler.spawnNpc(c, 3622, 3251, 9333, 0, 0, 100, 30, 10, 30, false, true);[/code]

item.title: [PI] Dungeoneering
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Hi,
I am currently adding dungeoneering to my PI and I am getting this one error every time I try to add this to the case in clickingbuttons.java and if I remove it, I get more errors.
Here is the error:

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:439: error: 'else' without 'if' } else { ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
Here is the case:

case 9158: if (c.dialogueAction == 8) { c.getPA().fixAllBarrows(); } else { c.dialogueAction = 0; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); } else { c.dialogueAction = 1327; c.getDungeoneering().leaveDung(c); break; }
I know its trying to tell me that I need to add “else if” instead but if I do that I get even more errors…
I have added my ClickingButtons.java if that is needed.
EDIT: I have fixed the error above but now I am getting 9 errors saying they cannot find symbols…
Dungeoneering.java is in my Skills folder but I am not entirely sure where to import this:

This is the error and I think that is why I am getting those errors…

src\server\model\players\Client.java:44: error: cannot find symbol private Dungeoneering dungeoneering = new Dungeoneering(this); ^ symbol: class Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:787: error: cannot find symbol public Dungeoneering getDungeoneering() { ^ symbol: class Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:44: error: cannot find symbol private Dungeoneering dungeoneering = new Dungeoneering(this); ^ symbol: class Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:160: error: cannot find symbol if (Dungeoneering.Dung(this)) { ^ symbol: variable Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:161: error: package Dungeoneering does not exist Dungeoneering.gameRoom.remove(this); ^ src\server\model\players\Client.java:309: error: cannot find symbol if (Dungeoneering.Dung(this)) { ^ symbol: variable Dungeoneering location: class Client src\server\model\players\Client.java:310: error: package Dungeoneering does not exist Dungeoneering.gameRoom.remove(this); ^ src\server\model\players\ActionHandler.java:25: error: cannot find symbol Dungeoneering.handleObject(c, objectType, obX, obY); ^ symbol: variable Dungeoneering location: class ActionHandler Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 8 errors Press any key to continue . . .
